Welcome!
Thank you for participating in this study about decision-making!
What happens next

• Each part includes specific instructions. Please read them carefully, as your decisions affect your final payment.
  • In this study, there is no hidden information or deception.
  • The study is made up of 2 blocks. In total, you will make about X decisions, and the study takes around X minutes.
Payment
• For your participation, you will receive {participation_fee}. Additionally, you can earn bonus points based on your decisions.
Additional information

• Participation is voluntary. You may leave the study at any time, in which case your data will be deleted. Compensation is only provided upon completion.
  • Your anonymity is guaranteed throughout the study, both to other participants and researchers.
  • All data is used solely for scientific purposes.
By clicking "I CONSENT," you confirm that you have read and understood the information above and agree to participate in the study.
For questions, concerns, or suggestions, please contact:

Charlotte Rossetti, Caroline Graf and Jörg Gross
University of Zürich, Switzerland
Throughout the study, you will be paired with other participants. The pairings are hypothetical but based on how participants could interact.
You can receive bonus points based on your decisions. At the end of the study, the bonus points you collected will be converted into money at the following conversion rate:
1 point = {conversion} GBP
In addition to the compensation you receive for participating, you can receive bonus points based on your own and other participants' decisions.
Block 1

There are two blocks in this study. In the first block, you will make decisions in different situations and in different roles. One situation and one role from this block will be randomly selected to determine your bonus points.
Block 2

In the second block, you will make additional decisions in different situations, using your bonus points from the first block. After the second block, one situation will be randomly selected to determine your final bonus points.
After the study

Bonus points are calculated after all participants have completed the study. They cannot be negative. Since you will not know which decisions will count, you should treat each decision as if it is selected.
Please read the instructions carefully, as your decisions affect your payoff.
In each decision, you will be paired with a different study participant. You will also be assigned a role for every decision (for example, Person A or Person B).
A decision can look like this:

Person A receives 12 points.
Person B receives 0 points.
Person A decides how many of the 12 points to give to Person B and how many to keep for themselves. Person B does not make a decision.
In the next parts, each interaction has two stages.
In Stage 1, Person A always receives 12 points and decides how many to give to Person B.
After Person A makes their decision, Stage 2 begins.
In Stage 2, Person A and Person B both receive additional 4 points. Then, Person B can remove points from Person A. Removing 1 point from Person A costs Person B {cost_per_point}.
Depending on the situation, you can be Person A or Person B.
Now there is one change.
There will be a third person: Person C.
Person B is not able to remove points anymore. Instead, Person C is able to remove points from Person A.
In Stage 2, Person C receives additional 4 points. Removing 1 point from Person A costs Person C {cost_per_point}. Points removed by Person C are eliminated.
